lines.translation: Autumn like autumn
lines.grammar: Simile with 'kā' (like/as); nominal clause without a verb for a gnomic tone.

lines.text: Biezie un gājputni laižas uz Nīlu
lines.translation: The rich and the migratory birds descend toward the Nile
lines.grammar: Verb 'laižas' (reflexive/middle) = come down/settle; motion preposition 'uz' + accusative for destination; proper name 'Nīlu'.

lines.translation: Suddenly it seemed to me
lines.grammar: Impersonal verb 'likās' (it seemed) + dative experiencer 'man'.

lines.text: Tu esi mans draugs un es tevi mazliet mīlu
lines.translation: You are my friend and I love you a little
lines.grammar: Copular 'esi'; object pronoun order 'es tevi mīlu'; diminutive adverb 'mazliet' softens degree.

lines.translation: The sun rose and fell
lines.grammar: Past narrative with simple preterites 'cēlās' (rise, reflexive) and 'krita' (fell).

lines.text: Es biju tavs meistars un tu mana Margarita
lines.translation: I was your master and you my Margarita
lines.grammar: Copular past 'biju'; possessive adjectives 'tavs/mana'; cultural allusion to 'Meistars un Margarita'.

lines.translation: Can you explain?
lines.grammar: Question particle omitted; verb-first question; 'proti' = 'are you able'.

lines.translation: If at first it seemed a little
lines.grammar: Conditional 'ja' clause; impersonal 'likās' again with implicit subject 'it'.

lines.translation: Then now very, very
lines.grammar: Contrastive 'tad'; intensifier 'jau'; reduplication 'ļoti, ļoti' for emphasis; ellipsis of predicate.

lines.text: Kāds mūs sauc tepat aiz stūra
lines.translation: Someone calls us right there around the corner
lines.grammar: Indefinite 'kāds' (someone); adverb 'tepat' (right here); complex preposition 'aiz' (behind/round) + noun.

lines.translation: Or quietly taps at the windowsill
lines.grammar: Disjunction 'vai' (or); verb 'dauzās' (knocks/taps, middle); preposition 'pie' (at/by).

lines.text: Laid savus putnus ārā no būra
lines.translation: Let your birds out of the cage
lines.grammar: Imperative 'Laid' (2sg of 'laist'); particle 'ārā' (out); preposition phrase 'no būra' (out of + genitive).

lines.text: Uz kurieni tie lidos, tur arī es
lines.translation: Wherever they will fly, there I'll be too
lines.grammar: Interrogative/directional 'uz kurieni' (to where); future 'lidos'; deictic 'tur' + particle 'arī' (also).

lines.translation: Still very, very
lines.grammar: Adverb 'joprojām' = still; repetition for emphasis; predicate elided from context.

lines.translation: When we fed the ducks
lines.grammar: Temporal clause with 'kad'; 1pl past 'barojām'; direct object plural 'pīles'.

lines.text: Asaras krita tev lielas kā ozola zīles
lines.translation: Tears fell from you, big as an oak's acorns
lines.grammar: Subject 'asaras' (tears); simile 'kā'; genitive relation 'ozola zīles' (oak's acorns).

lines.translation: Times draw arcs
lines.grammar: Metaphorical present; verb 'mest' (to throw/cast) with object 'lokus' (arcs).

lines.translation: Sometimes the sun hides in the chestnut trees
lines.grammar: Frequency adverb 'dažreiz'; reflexive 'slēpjas'; locative phrase 'kastaņu kokos'.

lines.translation: Like sailors [their] rum
lines.grammar: Elliptical comparison with 'kā'; object left implicit by parallelism; poetic truncation.

lines.text: Tu gribi Munameģi, es braukšu uz Karakumu
lines.translation: You want Munamägi, I'll go to the Karakum
lines.grammar: 2sg present 'gribi' vs. 1sg future 'braukšu'; motion preposition 'uz' (to) + proper names.

lines.translation: With red carnations it's time to say goodbye
lines.grammar: Preposition 'ar' (with) + attributive adjective 'sarkanām'; impersonal 'laiks' (it's time) + infinitive.

lines.translation: It is autumn
lines.grammar: Simple present copular statement without explicit 'būt' (to be) auxiliary pronounced.

lines.translation: People wander through lonely puddles
lines.grammar: Plural subject 'ļaudis'; motion preposition 'pa' (through/along); descriptive adjective 'vientuļām'.

lines.text: Kāds mūs sauc tepat aiz stūra
lines.translation: Someone calls us right there around the corner
lines.grammar: Chorus reprise; deixis 'tepat' + spatial 'aiz stūra' (around the corner).

lines.translation: Or quietly taps at the windowsill
lines.grammar: Verb 'dauzās' in middle voice; 'pie' introduces contact location.

lines.text: Laid savus putnus ārā no būra
lines.translation: Let your birds out of the cage
lines.grammar: Imperative 'Laid'; particle chain 'ārā no' (out of) + genitive complement.

lines.text: Uz kurieni tie lidos, tur arī es
lines.translation: Wherever they will fly, there I'll be too
lines.grammar: Future 'lidos' for planned motion; correlative 'uz kurieni … tur'.
